page.title: 14THE VILLAGE FETE
page.content: Most fetes claim to have "something for everyone" but on June 15th 1985, St. Mary's really meant it.Stalls and sideshows,manned by mercenaries whose magnetic fingers attracted money, occupied the rectory lawn.The Fordham Hall provided rest for the weary & help for the hungry; sit down teas available all afternoon on a self- service basis were greatly appreciated Meanwhile, in church, an ancient village map was displayed & two members of the Village Research Group helped a steady stream of visitors interested in tracing their ancestry or seeking information about their house names.Then a group of Village School children showed how quickly they were adapting to using a computer by demonstrating some of the work they had done on the Domesday project.The sun shone! All this & profit-Â£900-too!
